newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Fortune joint venture in oil storage loan facility.
newsitem.headline: Fortune joint venture in oil storage loan facility.

text.p: Fortune Oil Plc said on Wednesday its joint venture company Zhuhai S.E.Z. South China Petroleum Co Ltd has entered into a US$17 million syndicated loan facility to finance an oil storage farm in southern China.

The terminal, West Zhuhai Products Terminal and Storage Facility in Zhuhai, in southern China's Guangdong province, will have capacity to store 120,000 tonnes of oil products and can be expanded in stages to 300,000 tonnes, Fortune said.
A jetty, which can accomodate tankers of up to 80,000 deadweight tonnes, is nearing completion, while the storage facility is expected to be onstream in the third quarter of 1997, it said.

Zhuhai S.E.Z. South China is 24.5 percent owned by Fortune, while Vitol Energy (Bermuda) Ltd has 30.5 percent, South China Petro-Chem Enterprise 35 percent, and Zhuhai S.E.Z. Electric Development (Group) Company 10 percent.
